qas.question: How many Ukrainians speak Russian natively as of 2004?
How many Ukrainians speak Russian actively as of 2004?
What percent of Ukraine is fluent in Russian as of 2006?
What percent of Ukraine use Russian as their main language as of 2006?
What is Russian's legal status in Ukraine?

answers.text: minority language, under the 1996 Constitution of Ukraine

plausible_answers.text: a language of inter-ethnic communication, and a minority language

qas.question: How does the World Factbook describe Russian as?
How many people worldwide read the World Factbook in 2001?
How many school students used the World Factbook in school in Ukraine in 2006?
What was the population of Russia in 2001?
How many readers does Demoskop Weekly have in Ukraine?

context: In Ukraine, Russian is seen as <b5_0>a language of inter-ethnic communication, and a <a4_0>minority language<b5_0/>, under the 1996 Constitution of Ukraine<a4_0/>. According to estimates from Demoskop Weekly, in 2004 there were <a0_0><b8_0>14,400,000<b8_0/><a0_0/> native speakers of Russian in the country, and <a1_0><b9_0>29 million<b9_0/><a1_0/> active speakers. <a2_0>65%<a2_0/> of the population was fluent in Russian in 2006, and <a3_0>38%<a3_0/> used it as the main language with family, friends or at work. Russian is spoken by 29.6% of the population according to a 2001 estimate from the World Factbook. <b6_0><b7_0>20%<b7_0/><b6_0/> of school students receive their education primarily in Russian.
